creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: rectangular cake; Penglai, mythical home of Daoist Immortals, on a pedestal of rock with open doors and crashing waves beneath, under the sun, moon and clouds, on one side; inscription on opposite side
text: This large, finely pressed ink stick is decorated on one side with Mount Peng-lai, the mythical island paradise home of the Taoist immortals in the Eastern Sea. Rising like a bizarre pedestal rock from the stylized waves, the mountain is similar to depictions of Peng-lai found in Taoist paintings. The reverse is impressed with the three character title, Peng-lai shan, (Mount Peng-lai) and a long, raised inscription describing the paradise followed by the signature, "made in the Garden of Bamboo Fields and Pure Pines," and two seals, "Harmony Spring."
title: Ink Stick
